reviews.sentence: Expectations are a dangerous thing. We stayed at Chateau Elan for our 5th wedding anniversary this past weekend. We were happy to be together relaxing but greatly disappointed in the resort. My husband and I have visited some lovely properties all over the world and with the build up from descriptions reviews photos etc. we were just expecting a lot lot more. Bottom line Chateau Elan is a typical upscale conference center hotel. There is not much charm about it. The room we stayed in was extremely average. The bed was the nicest part about it. The rest nothing special at all. I have seen nicer mini fridge arrangements in newer Hampton Inns. The shower head had almost no water pressure and the windows in our room were needing some maintenance regarding some rot at the bases. I wish I could say good things about the winery or the restaurants but it was all just very very average. The winery tour and tasting is overpriced. 15 min of tour in one room and then tasting for 20. We were going to use the spa but everything else was so average we figured spending 450 yes 450 for a couples massage was not worth it. Lastly as a NON WEDDING attendee it is a bit odd how many weddings they have going on one Saturday. We counted 4 that we could see. it is a strange feeling. Well now we know. We will not be rushing back.
Even though the winery was closed for renovations it was still nice to tour the Vineyard and take a look around.

The first issue was during the reservation. I had to call to change it from a Sunday Million Miles from Monday to Saturday Elan Escape. The lady I spoke with was helpful but slow like she hated her job slow. She said she would send an updated email later. When I got it I realized she did not change the day just the package. When I called back the next day a different person was there. He said oh let me see what the rates are. I explained I knew the rates because they were discussed the day before and she gave me the rate and suggested the package. Well It was all wrong. Apparently she still gave me the rates for a Sunday. It was about 89 more and there was no apology or attempt to adjust it. I was at this point hesitant about even going. We arrived and check in was quick. The valet was excellent and helpful. The room was nice except for the spotted mirror. The sheets were very crisp and a strange texture. The service outside the poor was the next issue. It was around 515pm so the crowd had died down and we waited and waited for wings and 2 drinks. My husband finally went to the bar and the waitress apologized she forgot to put it in. wait what. It was not super busy. We were disappointed. That was a dreadful 66 dollars and poor service. Dinner was a better experience. With the escape package you go to the buffet. It was nice and finally we had excellent service. The buffet was nice and well kept. Most of the items were covered. The night experience was great as well. We went to the lounge and enjoyed the Jazz and DJ party. There was a wedding group there and they were fun and included us in their celebration. We decided to order breakfast instead of the buffet. It was just OK. The delivery person uncovered the food and it cause it to chill fast. It was just plain. There is no microwave in the room so no reheat option. I guess we should have got on up and went back to the buffet. The winery trip the next day and it was super cool. do not expect the staff to tell you about the wine unles you ask questions. We enjoyed the tasting. We did the 25 flights. We ended with lunch at Paddys and Service there was amazing. She was caring friendly made great suggestions and just top notch. Overall our Elan Escape was just ok. Maybe I will try again and add the spa services. I guess after all these years of driving by it I expected more for the value. We cruise a ton and I guess I am spoiled by amenities.

Property needs renovation. The pool and fire pit area. The room needed to be renovated. The presentation of putting water bottles in a take out plastic bag on my door knock was completely unprofessional.

Undergoing Much Needed Renovations. The bed was comfortable and aside from the stain the sheets were nice. When you drive onto the property it looks very nice. The property is in real need of updating. The chair in our room had peeling upholstery and the carpet is dated. The room just needed an overhaul. There was a stain on the sheet that we covered with a pillow. Not sure what it was. They are undergoing renovations and began banging and drilling between 730 8 am. There was no sleep to be had under those circumstances so we got up and checked out. They should have put us away from that or at least let us know when we checked in so that we had a choice to stay or leave.
It ’s was good just wish all was not being renovated. That I was not told they were renovating and that I could have planed accordingly.

Winery tour guide was outstanding. What a surprise. Having visited many wineries in Napa Sonoma as well as Paso Robles in California we were expecting to be underwhelmed by a winery in Georgia. We were enlightened by our guide from Argentina who had had as much knowledge as ANY guides we have come across. And the wines were very good even though the grapes were transported to Château Élan for winemaking from California. The Inn was under remodeling so not top shape but definitely worth our time and money.

Compared to the services provided cheap and to the fact that the property is under huge refurbishing workers were active on Saturday morning at 720 am making it impossible to sleep it was super expensive and not worth it.
Elopement getaway. The resort is still under renovation with thst being said they moved restaurants around as a result. The pool is amazing.

Day at the Spa. The massage was great as well as time spent in the salt water pool. The spa could have decorated more for Christmas and the cafe menu needs updating. The inn is very nice and easy access to get to the estate. The food at the spa cafe was above average.

Exceptional. Walking distance to several really nice restaurants and the on site yoga class was greatDefinitely working out a few kinks with logistics given the renovation. But overall was just an amazing experience.

Overnight Stay. My husband and I are here now for a short getaway. We were looking forward to enjoying all areas of the resort following its recent renovation. We were particularly anticipating trying out Louis House of Bourbon and taking in the beautifully redone space in the evening following dinner. Unfortunately the entire bourbon bar is closed tonight for a private event. There was no mention of this on the hotels website when we booked a week ago. To have such a gorgeous fun main space closed entirely and especially right after the renovation has been celebrated is a drawback for resort guests. While there are other bar options Louis House of Bourbon provides a different kind of atmosphere. Management should rethink this in the future. We feel shortchanged as we will not get to experience. enjoy this space during our stay.

Weekend getaway at Chateu Elan. I just recently visited the newly renovated resort. My trip was for my sister ’s bday weekend. It was absolutely fabulous. The newly renovated Marc ’s restaurant spa and the winery made for an relaxing weekend away from the hustle and bustle of life.

Gorgeous Hotel. Great Wine Needs a Dress Code. We live in Alphareta but this was our first time coming to Chateau Elan. We decided to stay local for our anniversary husband ’s birthday so we booked a room last minute at this hotel. We ’ve heard so many great things about the hotel we were n’t disappointed. They apparently just remodeled which seems to be money well spent. The staff were all great. Super friendly provided excellent customer service from booking with reservations to checking out. Even though some of the things I reserved for us did n’t show up in the system Ie wine tasting dinner reservations at Marc the staff were all very accommodating. We were able to book a tasting 30 each attend the wine tour free for hotel guests sit down right away at Marc even without our reservations. For a Saturday evening the restaurant was n’t too busy. We walked from the wine tour tasting over to Marc which is in the same building which was super convenient since it was raining. With such a great remodel to keep the quality of the hotel.
Gorgeous multi million dollar renovations throughout the property.

In Town Girlfriend Getaway. Edd Karlan ensured we had a 5 Star experience on our recent in town get away. The renovated hotel takes your breath away the moment you enter the lobby. The decor artwork are elegant yet inviting with many fireplaces cozy nooks. We had a great meal at the Bourbon Bar with great entertainment here also at Paddys. The Spa services were impeccable. The rooms are nicely appointed with a modern feel. Definitely a 5 Star experience all around we will definitely return make this our in town get away.

Wine tasting and Dinner. Chateau Elans 25 million dollar remodel has transformed the winery and inn into a very special place. After our wonderful wine tasting and delicious dinner at Marcs we visited the inn for a wonderful suprise with a gorgeous remodel the Versaile and Louis House of Bourbon are spectacular. Thank you for making such a beautiful place for us to visit.
